Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: ruby

Arguments.Name: --copyright
Arguments.Description: Prints the copyright notice

Arguments.Name: --version
Arguments.Description: Prints the version of Ruby interpreter
Specifies the input record separator ($/) as an octal number

Arguments.Name: octal
Arguments.Description: octal

Arguments.Name: C
Arguments.Description: Causes Ruby to switch to the directory

Arguments.Name: directory
Arguments.Description: directory

Arguments.Name: F
Arguments.Description: Specifies input field separator ($;)

Arguments.Name: pattern
Arguments.Description: pattern

Arguments.Name: I
Arguments.Description: Used to tell Ruby where to load the library scripts. Directory path will be added to the load-path variable ($:)

Arguments.Name: directory
Arguments.Description: directory

Arguments.Name: K
Arguments.Description: Specifies KANJI (Japanese) encoding

Arguments.Name: kcode
Arguments.Description: kcode

Arguments.Name: S
Arguments.Description: Makes Ruby use the PATH environment variable to search for script, unless its name begins with a slash. This is used to emulate #! on machines that don't support it, in the following manner: #! /usr/local/bin/ruby # This line makes the next one a comment in Ruby \ exec /usr/local/bin/ruby -S $0 $*

Arguments.Name: T
Arguments.Description: Turns on taint checks at the specified level (default 1)

Arguments.Name: level
Arguments.Description: level

Arguments.Name: a
Arguments.Description: Turns on auto-split mode when used with -n or -p

Arguments.Name: c
Arguments.Description: Causes Ruby to check the syntax of the script and exit without executing. If there are no syntax errors, Ruby will print “Syntax OK” to the standard output

Arguments.Name: -d
Arguments.Description: Turns on debug mode. $DEBUG will be set to true

Arguments.Name: e
Arguments.Description: Specifies script from command-line while telling Ruby not to search the rest of arguments for a script file name

Arguments.Name: command
Arguments.Description: command

Arguments.Name: -h
Arguments.Description: Prints a summary of the options

Arguments.Name: i
Arguments.Description: Specifies in-place-edit mode. The extension, if specified, is added to old file name to make a backup copy

Arguments.Name: extension
Arguments.Description: extension

Arguments.Name: l
Arguments.Description: Enables automatic line-ending processing, which means to firstly set $\ to the value of $/, and secondly chops every line read using chop!

Arguments.Name: n
Arguments.Description: Causes Ruby to assume the following loop around your script

Arguments.Name: p
Arguments.Description: Acts mostly same as -n switch, but print the value of variable $_ at the each end of the loop

Arguments.Name: r
Arguments.Description: Causes Ruby to load the library using require

Arguments.Name: library
Arguments.Description: library

Arguments.Name: s
Arguments.Description: Enables some switch parsing for switches after script name but before any file name arguments (or before a --)

Arguments.Name: -v
Arguments.Description: Enables verbose mode

Arguments.Name: w
Arguments.Description: Enables verbose mode without printing version message at the beginning. It sets the $VERBOSE variable to true

Arguments.Name: x
Arguments.Description: Tells Ruby that the script is embedded in a message. Leading garbage will be discarded until the first that starts with “#!” and contains the string, “ruby”. Any meaningful switches on that line will applied. The end of script must be specified with either EOF, ^D (control-D), ^Z (control-Z), or reserved word __END__. If the directory name is specified, Ruby will switch to that directory before executing script

Arguments.Name: directory
Arguments.Description: directory

Arguments.Name: -y
Arguments.Description: Turns on compiler debug mode. Ruby will print a bunch of internal state messages during compiling scripts. You don't have to specify this switch, unless you are going to debug the Ruby interpreter
